page.title: 13LIFEBOAT STATION
page.content: THE CAISTER-ON-SEA LIFEBOAT STATION Mr. Ron Munford came to,our school to talk about the Lifeboat station. In 1857 the RNLI assumed responsibility for the Lifeboat, and between 1867 and 1929 two lifeboats were stationed at Caistwr. In 1969 the RNLI withdrew their lifeboat & closed the station. Up to this date the boats had saved more lives than any other station in the British Isles. After this date, local Beach Men kept there long tradition of Lifesaving and now provide a private service, unique in this country, under Mr.Munford's leadership. Public support is VITAL to maintain this service. They have two boats, one will carry two crew, the other,the 'Shirley Jean Adie',an ex-RNLI boat, carries 8 crew.
